content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, fu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, fu.value, " ", fu.unit)
end
```

In this code, we first define the struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` of type `Float64` and `unit` of type `String`. Then, we define a `show` method for `FloatWithUnits` that takes an IO stream and a `FloatWithUnits` object as arguments. This method prints the value and unit of the `FloatWithUnits` object with a space in between.
